author: Niko Winarta
comment: The layout is very easy to use. It sometimes crashes when I open on my phone. The only problem I am having is that both save for later and send to pocket buttons are not working.  I am not seeing the articles in either accounts.
title: Very useful

comment: Unfortunately I can't use this. When trying to log into Feedly using my Google account the Google OAuth page throws a 403 error with   Error: disallowed_useragent

author: Chris Beger
comment: Wouldn't it be possible to use a Chrome Custom tab to avoid having to blindly trust that this isn't phishing? (No offense, but its just a best practices sort of thing).

reply.author: taqanori
reply.content: That's right. There are no way to ensure that authorization view is exactly provided by Feedly because Feedly API does not support PIN code authorization, in which authorization view is shown on your trusted web browser. So, all I can say is "Trust me!" or "Please perform TCP packet capture", and you should never use any other Feedly apps.

title: Question

author: Tony Kenyon
comment: Unistalled and Re installed and now will not log into Google. This user agent is not allowed to make a 0auth authorisation to google.

author: Thorby Corvin
comment: Feedly and pocket on your Android wear

author: Jordan Hotmann
comment: I just launch this manually when I have a quick moment to kill. Great for boring meetings or when waiting in the dentist chair.
title: Simple yet effective

author: Andrew Bernstein
comment: was waiting for a feedly app on wear. this works perfectly

author: Nigel Sharp
comment: Been using this one on my LG G Watch for a little while now and it's great! Simple and effective
title: So far so good

author: Paul Develter
comment: Excellent concept,  great options, HOWEVER,  the items only display a very small number of characters for each feed item meaning I have no idea what they say and I can't open them on my watch so there's no point. I wish this was better.
title: Can't read anything

author: Ricardo Tamez
comment: Ive been syncing it with my g account and facebook back and forth but a notificacion on my watch that says "no cards" or something like that pops so I never got any "news" so yeah
title: I t doesnt work

author: Matt Gardner
comment: This would be a lot better with a few improvements. It should show the source of the article along with the title. There should be an option to save to pocket. And it would be nice if you could see the whole article title when scrolling, instead of having to tap on each article.
title: Decent, but needs work

author: Tomáš Chovanec
comment: Try to log into my feedly account with google and app crashed. Tried it multiple times but with the same result. Sorry but this app dont deserve to be in PlayStore.

author: Brock Murley
comment: Wouldn't let me sign in with my Google account. Kept saying something about java script not active when it is on all my phone browsers.

reply.author: taqanori
reply.content: I'm very sorry that my application has irritated you so much. The actual problem is that, some people's google account needs javascript execution (somehow mine does not need it) and javascript was set to off in the internal browser of my application. I've set javascript of the internal browser ON in  version 1.2. I hope that solve the problem.

title: Useless.
